text: Mikio Aoki (, Hepburn: ; 8 June 1934 â€“ 11 June 2023) was a Japanese politician who served as the Chief Cabinet Secretary from 1999 to 2000, and was briefly Acting Prime Minister following Keizo Obuchi's coma. A member of the Liberal Democratic Party, he also served as the Chairman of the LDP in the House of Councillors. He studied at Waseda University but did not graduate. Aoki died on 11 June 2023 three days after his 89th birthday. ==References== Category:1934 births Category:2023 deaths Category:Prime ministers of Japan Category:Politicians from Shimane Prefecture Category:Liberal Democratic Party (Japan) politicians Category:Chief Cabinet Secretaries of Japan
title: Mikio Aoki
